thread.title_full: Human body in focus at Art Gallery of SA

author: Tom Fedorowytsch
title: Human body in focus at Art Gallery of SA
text:
Renowned French sculptor Auguste Rodin will be celebrated by the Art Gallery of South Australia as it challenges his works with some from contemporary artists. 
In 1996, the Adelaide gallery acquired 20 bronze sculptures and a drawing from Rodin. 
Now to mark a century since his death, it will unveil an exhibition Versus Rodin: Bodies Across Space and Time. 
Curator Leigh Robb said changing perceptions and depictions of the human body would be the focus. 
"We're bringing together 60 artists and over 200 works into a vivid dialogue with Auguste Rodin," she said. 
"The exhibition will contain a series of duets and duels, looking at the treatment of the body by artists over time. 
"It's a really exciting moment to look at how artists have approached the human figure and representing the human condition through sculpture, photography, painting, video and installation." Photo: This nude monument is an Auguste Rodin work in the Art Gallery of SA collection. (Supplied: Art Gallery of SA) 
The Art Gallery of SA said its collection of Rodin works was the largest in the southern hemisphere. 
The exhibition will include pieces from both Australian and international artists, including five commissioned artworks and others never seen in Australia before. 
"Auguste Rodin was an artist who turned matter into movement, and worked surfaces until they pulsed with emotion," Ms Robb said. 
Versus Rodin will open on March 4 and continue until July.
